LanguageData.WakeUpAddiction.label: adicción al despertar
LanguageData.WakeUpAddiction.description: A chemical addiction to wake-up. Long-term presence of wake-up has caused neurological adaptations at the cellular level, so the brain can no longer function properly without the drug.\n\nWithout regular doses of wake-up, withdrawal symptoms will begin. However, extended abstinence will force the brain to adapt back to its normal state, resolving the addiction.
LanguageData.WakeUpAddiction.stages.withdrawal.label: abstinencia
LanguageData.WakeUpHigh.label: drogado con despertar
LanguageData.WakeUpHigh.description: Wake-up in the bloodstream. Fills the need for rest by stimulating the brain.
LanguageData.WakeUpTolerance.label: tolerancia al despertar
LanguageData.WakeUpTolerance.description: A built-up tolerance to wake-up. The more severe this tolerance is, the more wake-up it takes to get the same effect.
LanguageData.WakeUpTolerance.stages.small-0.label: mínima
LanguageData.WakeUpTolerance.stages.small-1.label: ligera
LanguageData.WakeUpTolerance.stages.large.label: grande
LanguageData.WakeUpTolerance.stages.massive.label: altísima
